Welcome to python-chrono’s documentation!¶

python-chrono is a Python module for simple and convenient date/time handling, including parsing, arithmetic, comparison, formatting, and calendar functionality. It supports both the ISO and US calendars, and dates/times in ISO, US, or european formats.

The module is written by Erik Grinaker <erikg@codepoet.no>, and licensed under the GNU General Public License version 3.

The project website is located at http://oss.codepoet.no/python-chrono/

Contents:

  • Installation
    • Requirements
    • Installing from source
  • Usage
    • Parsing
    • Calendar info
    • Arithmetic
    • Formatting
    • Comparison
  • chrono.Date - Main class for date handling
  • chrono.DateTime - Main class for datetime handling
  • chrono.Time - Main class for time handling
  • chrono.calendar - Calendar-related classes
    • chrono.calendar.Calendar - Base class for calendars
    • chrono.calendar.ISOCalendar - ISO 8601 calendar functionality
    • chrono.calendar.USCalendar - US calendar functionality
  • chrono.clock - Clock-related classes
    • chrono.clock.Clock - Basic 24-hour clock
    • chrono.clock.USClock - US 12-hour clock
  • chrono.error - Exceptions
  • chrono.formatter.Formatter - Template formatting for dates and times
  • chrono.parser - Parsers for various date/time formats
    • chrono.parser.Parser - Base class for parsers
    • chrono.parser.CommonParser - Parser for most common formats
    • chrono.parser.EuroParser - Parser for european formats
    • chrono.parser.ISOParser - Parser for ISO 8601 formats
    • chrono.parser.USParser - Parser for US formats
  • chrono.utility - Utility functions
